before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ev8o","text":"This protocol was developed using the Liverpool strain of Ae. aegypti reared under optimal conditions at 27°C, 80% RH and a 12:12 (L:D) photoperiod. Larvae were reared in 14 x 8 x 5 “ containers and fed a slurry of Tetramin fish food (Spectrum Brands Pet, LLC, Blacksburg, VA) ad libitum. Adults were provided with raisins as a sugar source.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4a7nj","text":"The collection, fixing, and immunohistochemical staining of Aedes aegypti embryos is challenging in comparison to D. melanogaster since the vitelline membrane of Ae. aegypti must be manually removed. Herein we report on an improvement for the methods to prepare Ae. aegypti embryos. The adapted protocol increases the throughput capacity of embryos by an individual user, with experienced users able to process an average of 100-150 embryos per hour. The protocol provides high-quality intact embryos that can be used for morphological, immunohistochemical, and in situ RNA hybridization studies. Critical to the success of the optimized protocol is the selection and description of the tools required, and differing approaches for younger and older embryos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"atral","text":"Create an entry port for mosquitoes by drilling a hole that is slightly larger than the outer diameter of a 10 mL serological pipette into the 50 mL conical tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8jsj","text":"Use a strip of laboratory tape to create a removable closure over the entry port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"964ec","text":"Place a second smaller section of tape on the back of the tape closure so that when the mosquito entry port is closed, there is no sticky side of the tape facing the inside of the 50 mL conical tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"647bs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cjj59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ted5","text":"Alternatively two layers of dental dam with orthogonal slits can be taped over the entry port.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Set up for electrosharpening a tungsten wire.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97rbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97pbixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97qbixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97nbixhp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"10cnu","text":"Secure the tungsten wire in an inoculating loop holder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d122r","text":"Connect the anode (negative terminal) of a 9V battery to a 1.0M solution of KOH or NaOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s9t3","text":"Connect the cathode (positive terminal) of the 9V battery to the metallic end of the inoculating loop holder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lsb7","text":"Repeatedly dip the end of the tungsten wire into the 1.0M solution of KOH (or NaOH) to electrosharpen the tungsten wire.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0mg7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ctu4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"39qcl","text":"Periodically check the tungsten wire under a stereoscope to determine if additional Electrosharpening is needed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

(A) Aspirator to collect females; (B) Soapy water morgue for killing males; (C) Egging chamber to allow females to lay eggs; (D) Overlapping of filter paper strips for oviposition; (E) 6-cm Petri dish for ageing embryos; (F) Shoe box humid chamber to maintain humidity during embryo ageing.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97vbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97tbixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97ubixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n97sbixhp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak79g","text":"Provide the mosquitoes with a fresh blood meal three to five days post adult emergence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgb7q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"74gke","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fh962","text":"When using a non-live blood source (e.g., a Hemotek feeder), the addition of ATP to the blood at a final concentration of 10 µM encourages females to take a full meal.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"im25","text":"Four days post blood meal, use the aspirator to transfer 20-50 females into an egging chamber lined with three overlapping strips of wetted Whatman #1 filter paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2pfm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ho05","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7qu91","text":"On the third day post blood meal, aspirate the males from the cage and kill in soapy water. Males can be visually identified by their plumose antennae. Replace any open water source for the mosquitoes with clean water since females will lay eggs on any dead mosquitoes floating on the water. Alternatively, the water cup can be removed entirely, but do not deprive mosquitoes of water for longer than 10-12h. The 20-50 females can be collected in a single aspiration.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7d68o","text":"Darken the conical tube by covering the tube with aluminum foil. Allow the mosquitoes to lay eggs undisturbed for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":114,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"53td","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3e1a6","text":"Transfer the egg paper to a plastic petri dish lid lined with two layers of wetted Whatman #1 filter paper and close the lid with the bottom of the dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24b7e","text":"Rinse embryos into the egg basket with distilled water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5tmq","text":"Generously rinse embryos in distilled water three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvcol","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akjmd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"21pis","text":"The embryos need to be rinsed profusely to remove any residual bleach. In addition, rinse the egg basket with water to make sure that residual bleach is not present.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d479e","text":"Rinse embryos from the egg basket into a scintillation vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Embryos can be submerged in the PEM-F by dropping droplets of PEM-F on them until they sink.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39top","text":"Incubate embryos in PEM-F at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2bdj7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"60","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44lhs","text":"Remove the PEM-F and add 10 mL of heptane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5vv0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"34afh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5p4od","text":"It is important to remove all of the PEM-F before adding the heptane. In addition, the embryos should swirl freely in the heptane, otherwise they will not stick to the tape during the manual peeling step. If the embryos stick to the scintillation vial, add 10 mL of methanol and shake the embryos for 30 seconds. Remove the heptane and methanol, then add 10 mL of fresh heptane. If the embryos now swirl freely, proceed to step 17, otherwise repeat the methanol wash and the repeat addition of the heptane.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93gj2","text":"Transfer embryos to a   freezer for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1tc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-70","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fuphk","text":"Add   methanol and shake the vial under running hot ( ) water for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4q7o4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqrh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etnk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"60","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3slk1","text":"The freezer/running hot water steps are carried over from Clemons et al. (2010). In our experience, steps 31 and 32 can be conducted at room temperature with no detrimental effects.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53a62","text":"Remove the upper heptane layer and most of the methanol from the embryos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81sl7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"21g0n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9bjme","text":"Let the scintillation vial stand for 5 minutes to allow the heptane to separate from the methanol. The embryos will collect into a group at both the bottom of the methanol layer and at the heptane: methanol interface. When enough of the heptane layer has been removed, the embryos at the heptane:methanol interface will sink and combine with the embryos grouped at the bottom of the methanol layer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7n5to","text":"Add an additional   methanol to the scintillation vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"hpjh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4uo8a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjvla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3tm9u","text":"The embryos can be collected into a pile by swirling the scintillation vial.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8a80n","text":"Transfer embryos to a 1.5 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77ema","text":"Wash embryos with three changes of   of 100% methanol. Embryos can be stored in methanol at  . Alternatively proceed with the rehydration step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"s0pa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1h5ka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22n57","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vu19","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2rv80","text":"The vitelline membrane of younger embryos (\u003c20h old after egg laying at 27°C) can be difficult to remove if embryos are maintained under methanol for extended periods of time. We recommend that younger embryos be rehydrated following the methanol washing steps and the vitelline membrane removed within a few days.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25ubf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cvo8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dcn5l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgpti","text":" Rehydrate the embryos using a methanol/PBS(P) dilution series (1 mL and 10 min each): 75%, 50%, 25%, 100% PBS(P), PT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ogj6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"co588","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":0,"id":425179,"is_video":true,"legend":"","mime":"video/mp4","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Aligning_embryos.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9g7bixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9g5bixhp.mp4","type":3,"width":0}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":182,"id":425913,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"ar32\",\"text\":\"Figure 6. Alignment of embryos for removal of the vitelline membrane. (A) Glass plate with a strip of wetted filter paper overlayed with a glass coverslip; (B) Fixed embryos transferred to the wetted filter paper; (C) Embryos aligned against the edge of the glass coverslip with the anterior ends to the right; (D) Drying of the filter paper to 'break' the PBS connection between the glass coverslip and the filter paper; (E) Embryos shifted to the edge of the glass plate to facilitate embryo transfer to the double faced tape; (F) Strip of double faced tape affixed to the edge of a 22mm plastic coverslip with the top edge peeled back for easier removal of the protective paper cover; (G) transfer of the embryos to the edge of the double faced tape; (H) Transfer of the double faced tape to a well slide with the embryos top-side up;( I) Flooding of the well with PBS; (J) The final well slide with PBS-submerged embryos and the plastic coverslip removed.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n975bixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n973bixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n974bixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n972bixhp.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2vel1","text":"Add the methanol/PBS(P) solutions slowly so that the embryos will rehydrate under the solutions.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a1s7c","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5srci","text":"Replace the final rehydration with a new   aliquot of PT and store embryos   at   prior to peeling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":75,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4dln8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5b9p9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btcd1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lc0s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3digd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":122},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":127}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3pscr","text":"The embryos can be peeled immediately following rehydration; however they tend to peel easier if they are allowed to soak   at   in PT buffer.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cbdof","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"},"1":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l822","text":"Wet a 1”x2” square of Whatman #1 filter paper with PBS(P) and place on a smooth glass surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d7nj","text":"Add a glass coverslip so that it slightly overlaps onto the filter paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c49qh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ifnr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b486f","text":"Make sure that there are no air bubbles underneath the coverslip. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12j1j","text":"Flood the underneath of the coverslip with PBS(P) so that a complete “water bridge” is formed. Wick off any excess PBS(P).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3aemb","text":"Affix an equal-length strip of double-faced tape to the edge (1-2 mm overlapping) of a plastic coverslip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"efui3","text":"Trim the other edge of the double-faced tape to leave a clean edge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nev4","text":"Peel back a corner of the tape backing and place the prepared transfer tape aside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62e6k","text":"Add 50-100 fixed embryos along the edge of the glass coverslide overlapping the wetted filter paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ao0ik","text":"Gently brush embryos to the edge glass coverslip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mso6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ai34r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f7arq","text":"Discard broken or misshapen embryos. Add and remove PBS(P) as needed to maintain a level of wetness so that the eggs remain wet, but the paper is dry enough to be able to move an egg without it floating out of position.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6v2vn","text":"Use a fine tipped paintbrush to position the posterior (thinner end) of the embryo towards the edge of the glass slide and the anterior (wider end) away from the glass slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ao6p7","text":"Continue to align embryos tightly against each other until all embryos have been aligned.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl5r9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9hmfv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a1lt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"50hvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9ulmf","text":"The embryos should be touching each other in the alignment.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":0,"id":425183,"is_video":true,"legend":"","mime":"video/mp4","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Tape_transfer_of_embryos.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9habixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9g9bixhp.mp4","type":3,"width":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ncn7","text":"Remove the PBS from underneath the glass coverslip by pressing paper toweling onto the filter paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anp71","text":"Remove the glass coverslip and gently move the line of embryos towards the edge of the glass plate by sliding the paper across the glass surface without lifting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3993m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d34tv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fmu96","text":"Alternatively, the tape can be added to the embryos without moving the paper, however we find it easier to properly overlay the tape if the filter paper is moved to the edge of the glass surface.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68li4","text":"Transfer the embryos to the double faced tape so that the anterior of the embryos slightly overhangs the outer edge of the tape. Gently press on the backing of the double faced tape to ensure that the embryos are affixed to the tape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1a4uq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4atgk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"336ch","text":"It is important to press gently so that the embryos are not crushed during the transfer","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cor86","text":"Remove the tape backing and place the tape into the well of a glass well slide (embryo side up).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41rn","text":"Flood the well with PBS(P). Add PBS(P) as needed to prevent the embryos from drying out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gdbq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hi7p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"chlb2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9glc3","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":2,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b891m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"avrle","text":"Make a small incision at the anterior of each embryo using a fine stab knife.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"384nu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"35bvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":0,"id":425185,"is_video":true,"legend":"","mime":"video/mp4","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Peeling_older_embryos.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9hdbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9hbbixhp.mp4","type":3,"width":0}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":165,"id":425917,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"24mpm\",\"text\":\"Figure 7. Tools used for removal of the vitelline membrane. (A) Stab knife for the creation of a slit towards the anterior end of the embryo; (B) Sharpened tungsten wire probe for removal of the anterior end of the embryo; (C) Roboz tool for extrusion of the embryo following removal of the anterior end of the embryo.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n979bixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n977bixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n978bixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n976bixhp.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":217,"id":425921,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2hb68\",\"text\":\"Figure 8. Intermediate and final steps in the removal of the vitelline membrane for older embryos. (A)  Aligned embryos with a small opening in the vitelline membrane at the anterior end made by the stab knife; (B,C,D) Removal of the anterior end \\\"cap\\\" of the embryo with a tungsten wire probe; (E,F,G) Extrusion of embryos from the vitelline membrane using the Roboz tool; (H) Peeled embryos ready for transfer to a 1.5 mL tube. The yellow arrows indicate the wire probe and Roboz tool in panels (C) and (F), respectively.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98dbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98bbixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98cbixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98abixhp.webp","width":550}},"3":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":326,"id":425925,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"31cok\",\"text\":\"Figure 9. The serosal cuticle retained on older embryos (52h AEL at 27°C). (A) 52h AEL embryo retaining the serosal cuticle indicated by the yellow arrows; (B) 52h AEL embryo free of the serosal cuticle.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98hbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98fbixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98gbixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98ebixhp.webp","width":550}},"4":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":0,"id":425190,"is_video":true,"legend":"","mime":"video/mp4","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Serosal_cuticle_add.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9hhbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9hgbixhp.mp4","type":3,"width":0}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9ihoc","text":"The poke or cut should not be deep into the embryo and only needs to be large enough for the insertion of a fine tungsten wire probe.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8k3al","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnbn2","text":"Carefully slip the anterior end of the vitelline membrane off of the embryos by gently inserting the tungsten wire underneath the membrane at the hole/seam and pushing forward with a very slight upward pressure. The main pressure of the tungsten wire should be forward with a very slight upward pressure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q5vf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"37ivh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3i1qv","text":"If the tip of the anterior end tears, use the tungsten wire to tuck the vitelline membrane into the tape glue.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nif9","text":"Remove the anterior end of the vitelline membranes from all of the embryos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g7v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"98ar7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6slt8","text":"By first removing the anterior end of the vitelline membranes from all of the embryos prior to extrusion, the cavity of the vitelline membrane is able to fill with PBS(P), making the embryos easier to extrude.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1l0l","text":"Rinse the loose vitelline membrane fragments from the slide with a gentle stream of PBS(P), then refill the reservoir with clean PBS(P).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fjan","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpin3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3r4fv","text":"This step is optional, however it will make it easier to collect the embryos without collecting fragments of the vitelline membrane.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bn847","text":"Using the blunt Roboz probe, gently push on the posterior end of the embryo until it extrudes out of the membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ft18v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"49rvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dn9c4","text":"When gently pushing on the posterior of the embryos to extrude the embryo, stop if the embryo no longer easily extrudes. Allow for the cavity of the vitelline membrane to refill with PBS(P), before continuing to push on the posterior of the embryo. We recommend partially extruding all embryos first, to allow for the cavities of the vitelline membranes to refill with PBS(P) before fully extruding all embryos.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6bjgo","text":"Move and press any extruded embryos retaining a serosal cuticle into the sticky surface of the double faced tape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cfd3i","text":"Tear the serosal cuticle at the anterior end of the embryo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5fs9q","text":"Extrude the embryo from the serosal cuticle by pushing on the posterior end of the embryo with the blunt side of the tungsten wire probe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"388qm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69bmc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2fnrv","text":"The serosal cuticle on embryos younger than 50-60h AEL at 27°C typically remains with the vitelline membrane and does not need to be manually removed following embryo extrusion from the vitelline membrane.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ca0qm","text":"Collect embryos into a pile and transfer into a 1.5 mL tube using a Pasteur pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3arro","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6anc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9dcuf","text":"Wet the glass pipette prior to transferring the embryos to prevent them from sticking to the glass pipette.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5df","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"743mp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93tos","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"973ao","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"18odv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4b5ua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30bdh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d7kd5","text":"Tear a small opening in the posterior of the embryo using the tungsten wire probe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":0,"id":425188,"is_video":true,"legend":"","mime":"video/mp4","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Peeling_younger_embryos.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9hfbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9hebixhp.mp4","type":3,"width":0}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bhtud","text":"This protocol has been successful for peeling embryos as young as 14h AEL at 27°C.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":458,"id":425929,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9egvm\",\"text\":\"Figure 10. Intermediate and final steps in the removal of the vitelline membrane for younger embryos following removal of the anterior end “cap” of the embryo. (A) Removal of the anterior end with the tungsten wire probe; (B) Cutting of the posterior end of the embryo; (C) Dissection of the vitelline membrane along the sagittal plane; (D) Release of the embryo by folding back the vitelline membrane. The yellow arrows indicate the tungsten wire probe. Follow steps 39 to 57 for the initial steps of peeling younger embryos.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98mbixhp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98jbixhp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98kbixhp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n98ibixhp.webp","width":550}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1pitg","text":"Younger embryos can be peeled identically to older embryos with the exception of being extruded using the Roboz tool.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9p4o0","text":"Insert the tungsten wire probe into the posterior opening of the vitelline membrane and carefully tear upwards in a stepwise fashion until the entire vitelline membrane has been dissected along the sagittal plane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"htgb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2df3o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ee4on","text":"Do this step incrementally to prevent tearing the embryo.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3j482","text":"The stab knife can also be used to dissect the length of the vitelline membrane.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsinp","text":"Press the edges of the vitelline membrane into the tape adhesive to free the embryo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fi00","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"euhi1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"veh1","text":"Do this step incrementally, alternating between left and right sides of the embryo if needed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er9tv","text":"Collect embryos into a pile and transfer into a 1.5 mL tube using a Pasteur pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"630ic","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"41q1t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"75jha","text":"Wet the glass pipette prior to transferring the embryos to prevent them from sticking to the glass pipette.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e20v7","text":"Store all peeled embryos at   and process for staining within one day for best results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8cko1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
